reasoning: Hermansky-Pudlak syndrome is rare autosomal recessive disorder affecting 1-2 per 500,000 to 1,000,000 globally. HPS2 (gene HPS2/AP3B1) represents a subset of HPS cases. Estimated prevalence ~0.2 per 100k in general population, with significant geographic clustering (much higher in Puerto Rican population ~1 per 1,800). Limited epidemiological data on HPS2-specific prevalence.
